Description: Crescent-shaped arsenical copper axe-head: with a flanged butt with three tangs drilled with five binding-holes. One of the lateral tangs has been turned by a blow at the tip, and the cutting edge is indented in several places. The blade is quite thickly corroded. Remains of the original wooden haft are preserved in the corrosion product near the butt, and traces of some organic matter, probably wood, survive on the faces.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (81)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
